description: The LIST file typically follows this format: deb http://host/debian distribution section1 section2 section3 deb-src http://host/debian distribution section1 section2 section3

The first word of each line notifies the archive type: deb means that it holds a binary package. deb-src means that it holds a source package. NOTE: The APT tool is found within the Debian operating system.
NOTE: The APT tool is found within the Debian operating system.

common_filenames.description: /etc/apt/sources.list - The default Debian file containing information where software can be downloaded from.
